subject: Re: [junit] Re: Digest Number 899
msgSnippet: ... Please use Windows help and learn about setting Environment Variables. (I m assuming you re on Windows.) Add the native library uvmtools.dll (I m guessing
messageBody:
>So said ok_lilya on 2003-06-19 --------------------
>Rainsberger,
>
>> 1. Remove VAJ from your system CLASSPATH *or*
>> 2. Add VAJ's binaries to your system PATH
>
>How do I do that?
>
>I don't think i have VAJ un system CLASSPATH. How do I know for sure??
>Also, how do I add VAJ's binaries to the system PATH - I think this
>might be a better solution..

Please use Windows help and learn about setting Environment Variables. (I'm assuming you're on Windows.)

Add the native library uvmtools.dll (I'm guessing at the name) to your PATH and try again.

Take care.


J. B. Rainsberger,
President, Diaspar Software Services
